question: What is the job of the Mother Board?
option1: Sends power to all the components
option2: Holds all the circuits and components together
option4: Tells the computer what to do
answer: Holds all the circuits and components together
explanation: A motherboard is the circuit board found in general purpose microcomputers . It holds and allows communication between many of the crucial electronic components of a system, such as the central processing unit and memory, and provides connectors for other peripherals.
